ðŸ”¥ rss-launchpad | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Quickly add new RSS/Atom subscriptions from websites.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Extracts RSS/Atom feeds from the active tab. â€¢ Opens feeds with an RSS reader app or custom web service. â€¢ Supports unofficial feeds for some popular websites (e.g., YouTube). â€¢ Indicates whether a website offers RSS/Atom feeds. â€¢ Basic integration with 3rd-party readers via buildable URLs.
ðŸ“– Summary: The RSS Launchpad extension simplifies RSS subscription management by extracting available feeds from websites. It allows users to easily subscribe to these feeds using their preferred RSS reader application or web service. The extension also supports unofficial feeds for certain websites, enhancing its versatility.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ the-mouse-is-lava | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Minimize mouse usage by providing keyboard shortcuts for web navigation.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Keyboard shortcuts for website navigation â€¢ Universal shortcuts (Ctrl+B to focus input, Ctrl+I to find links) â€¢ Website-specific shortcuts (e.g., Google search navigation) â€¢ Customizable keyboard shortcuts
ðŸ“– Summary: The Mouse is Lava is a Chrome extension that provides keyboard shortcuts to navigate websites, reducing the need for mouse interaction. It offers universal shortcuts for common actions like focusing input fields and finding links, as well as website-specific shortcuts for popular sites like Google. All shortcuts are customizable, allowing users to tailor the extension to their specific needs.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ Sn1per | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automated penetration testing and attack surface management to discover vulnerabilities and hidden assets.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Attack Surface Management â€¢ Vulnerability Scanning Automation â€¢ Hidden Asset Discovery â€¢ Risk Prioritization
ðŸ“– Summary: Sn1per is an attack surface management platform designed to automate penetration testing and vulnerability scanning. It integrates with various open-source and commercial tools to discover hidden assets, prioritize risks, and provide continuous security for organizations.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ upscayl | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Upscaling and enhancing the resolution of images using AI.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ AI Image Upscaling â€¢ Open Source â€¢ Cross-Platform (Linux, MacOS, Windows) â€¢ ESRGAN support â€¢ Gigapixel image upscaling
ðŸ“– Summary: Upscayl is a free and open-source AI image upscaler designed for Linux, MacOS, and Windows. It allows users to enhance the resolution of images using AI algorithms like ESRGAN, effectively turning low-resolution images into high-resolution ones. The primary use case is to improve the quality and detail of images, making them suitable for various applications.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ ghostty | Zig
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: A cross-platform terminal emulator designed for developers and users who require a fast, feature-rich, and standards-compliant terminal experience.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Fast terminal emulation â€¢ Feature-rich terminal emulation
ðŸ“– Summary: Ghostty is a terminal emulator written in Zig that aims to provide a fast, feature-rich, and cross-platform experience by leveraging native UI and GPU acceleration. It strives for standards compliance and competitive performance, with a roadmap that includes advanced features and broader platform support. The project aims to be a drop-in replacement for existing terminal emulators while pushing the boundaries of what's possible with modern terminal features.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ newspaper4k | HTML
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Scraping and curation of news articles from various websites.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Article extraction from news websites â€¢ Title extraction from news websites â€¢ Metadata extraction from news websites â€¢ CLI tool for command-line usage â€¢ Python API for programmatic access
ðŸ“– Summary: Newspaper4k is a Python library and CLI tool designed for extracting articles, titles, and metadata from news websites. It is a fork of the newspaper3k project, continuing its functionality with added features and bug fixes. The library provides both a command-line interface and a Python API for easy integration into various applications.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ blackcandy | Ruby
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Self-hosting a personal music streaming server.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Self-hosted music streaming server â€¢ Docker-based installation â€¢ Mobile app availability (iOS and Android) â€¢ Media file mounting â€¢ PostgreSQL database support
ðŸ“– Summary: Black Candy is a self-hosted music streaming server that allows users to create their own personal music center. It offers easy installation via Docker, supports media file mounting, and provides mobile apps for convenient access. The system can be configured to use either SQLite or PostgreSQL as a database.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ poco | Java
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Generating collector classes to extract specific data types from complex object structures, particularly useful in scenarios like inventory management where only certain data from orders, stocks, or returns is needed.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Generates collector classes for nested object types. â€¢ Eliminates the need for runtime reflection, improving performance.
ðŸ“– Summary: The PoCo framework generates collector classes for plain old Java objects (POJOs), enabling efficient extraction of specific data types from complex, nested object structures. By generating classes at build time, PoCo eliminates the need for runtime reflection, resulting in improved performance and easier error tracing. A Gradle plugin is provided for seamless integration into build processes.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
